cs.CC, cs.DS, cs.CG, cs.SC, cs.SY 

Reasoning: The paper deals with the computational complexity of Gröbner basis computation, which is a fundamental problem in computational algebraic geometry. This problem has connections to various areas of computer science, including complexity theory (cs.CC), data structures and algorithms (cs.DS), computational geometry (cs.CG), scientific computing (cs.SC), and control theory (cs.SY). The paper's focus on the robust hardness of Gröbner basis computation suggests that it may be of interest to researchers in these areas who are concerned with the resilience of algorithms to perturbations and noise.
